title: Preview: Friends of Manchester Festival 29/01
body:
In it’s third year, the **Friends of Manchester Festival** is once again showcasing some of the finest talent Manchester, and the friends thereof, have to offer.

Spread across two venues, **Jabez Clegg** and **Kro Bar**, this year also sees the introduction of a fantastic **For Folk**‘s **Sake** stage that will, rather aptly, present a platform for some of the North West’s best folk and acoustic acts to demonstrate their musical wares. Last year saw fantastic performances by **The Answering Machine**, **The Crookes** and **Detroit Social Club**, with the festival receiving critical acclaim from critics and fans alike.  A full line up of the festival is available [here](http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=312106193626), however, as to entice you further, here is a brief introduction to some of the acts performing.

Jim Noir:

Spokes:

 [We Can Make It Out (Radio Edit)](http://soundcloud.com/spokesband/we-can-make-it-out-radio-edit) by [S P O K E S](http://soundcloud.com/spokesband)

Run Toto Run:

 [Run Toto Run – The Low Blow](http://soundcloud.com/breaking-more-waves/run-toto-run-the-low-blow) by [Breaking More Waves](http://soundcloud.com/breaking-more-waves)

Wild Palms:

 [To The Lighthouse](http://soundcloud.com/wild-palms/09-to-the-lighthouse) by [Wild Palms](http://soundcloud.com/wild-palms)

If you’re in Manchester, or within a 100 mile radius, you have no excuse not to be there.
